rms.queries

Class UtilizationQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • rms.queries.UtilizationQueries

  • public class UtilizationQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    UtilizationQueries is a class that returns the utilization of a single resource,all the resources of a resource_type, or all resources in the table by day, by week, or by month. The utilization is returned as a decimal percentage.
    Author:
    Re:Syntellions

    • Method Detail

      • dailyUtilizationByResourceId

        public java.lang.Double dailyUtilizationByResourceId(int resourceId,
                                                     java.lang.String date)
                                              throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a day for a single resource. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by eight to return a percentage of utilization for that day. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a single day for a single room and divides it by 8 (the number of available hours in a day to book) to return the percentage of utilization for that room.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - Used to query the resource you wish to see the utilization for.
        date - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException - if the resource does not exist or if the date that is being queried does not exist.

      • weeklyUtilizationByResourceId

        public java.lang.Double weeklyUtilizationByResourceId(int resourceId,
                                                      java.lang.String startDate,
                                                      java.lang.String endDate)
                                               throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a week for a single resource. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 40 to return a percentage of utilization for that week. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a week for a single room and divides it by 40 (the number of available hours in a week to book) to return the percentage of utilization for that room.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - Used to query the resource you wish to see the utilization for.
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • monthlyUtilizationByResourceId

        public java.lang.Double monthlyUtilizationByResourceId(int resourceId,
                                                       java.lang.String startDate,
                                                       java.lang.String endDate)
                                                throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a month for a single resource. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 160 to return a percentage of utilization for that month. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a month for a single room and divides it by 160 (the average number of available hours in a month to book) to return the percentage of utilization for that room.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - Used to query the resource you wish to see the utilization for.
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • dailyUtilizationByResourceTypeId

        public java.lang.Double dailyUtilizationByResourceTypeId(int resourceTypeId,
                                                         java.lang.String date)
                                                  throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a day for all the resources of a single resource type. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by eight times the number of resources of the resource type provided to return a percentage of utilization for that day. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a single day for all the rooms of a single resource type and divides it by 8 (the number of available hours in a day to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for those rooms.
        Parameters:
        resourceTypeId - Used to query the resources of a certain resource type you wish to see the utilization for.
        date - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • weeklyUtilizationByResourceTypeId

        public java.lang.Double weeklyUtilizationByResourceTypeId(int resourceTypeId,
                                                          java.lang.String startDate,
                                                          java.lang.String endDate)
                                                   throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a week for all the resources of a single resource type. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 40 times the number of resources of the resource type provided to return a percentage of utilization for that week. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a week for all the rooms of a single resource type and divides it by 40 (the number of available hours in a week to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for those rooms.
        Parameters:
        resourceTypeId - Used to query the resources of a certain resource type you wish to see the utilization for.
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        Returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • monthlyUtilizationByResourceTypeId

        public java.lang.Double monthlyUtilizationByResourceTypeId(int resourceTypeId,
                                                           java.lang.String startDate,
                                                           java.lang.String endDate)
                                                    throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a month for all the resources of a single resource type. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 160 times the number of resources of the resource type provided to return a percentage of utilization for that month. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a month for all the rooms of a single resource type and divides it by 160 (the number of available hours in a month to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for those rooms.
        Parameters:
        resourceTypeId - Used to query the resources of a certain resource type you wish to see the utilization for.
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.

      • dailyUtilizationForAllResources

        public java.lang.Double dailyUtilizationForAllResources(java.lang.String date)
                                                 throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a day for all the resources. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by eight times the number of resources to return a percentage of utilization for that day. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a single day for all the rooms and divides it by 8 (the number of available hours in a day to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for all rooms.
        Parameters:
        date - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        Returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • weeklyUtilizationForAllResources

        public java.lang.Double weeklyUtilizationForAllResources(java.lang.String startDate,
                                                         java.lang.String endDate)
                                                  throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a week for all the resources. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 40 times the number of resources to return a percentage of utilization for that week. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a week for all the rooms and divides it by 40 (the number of available hours in a day to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for all rooms.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        Returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException

      • monthlyUtilizationForAllResources

        public java.lang.Double monthlyUtilizationForAllResources(java.lang.String startDate,
                                                          java.lang.String endDate)
                                                   throws org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
        Queries for all of the bookings within a month for all the resources. Takes the sum of all the differences of booked_end_time minus book_start_time and divides it by 160 times the number of resources to return a percentage of utilization for that month. In layman terms it takes all of the hours that were booked in a month for all the rooms and divides it by 160 (the average number of available hours in a day to book) times the number of resources of that resource type to return the percentage of utilization for all rooms.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        endDate - Used to limit the scope of utilization to the date provided.
        Returns:
        Returns a double that represents the percentage of utilization.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException
